snippet: Officials were far apart on Sunday over a trans-Atlantic pact that international companies must rely on to move digital data between the regions.
abstract: United States and Europe do not reach agreement over how digital data, including financial statistics and social media posts, can be transmitted between two regions; failure means that companies that transfer digital information could face legal gray area concerning privacy standards.
lead_paragraph: Officials were far apart on Sunday over a trans-Atlantic pact that international companies must rely on to move digital data between the regions.

headline.main: U.S. and Europe Fail to Meet Deadline for Data Transfer Deal
headline.print_headline: No Deal Yet in U.S. Talks With Europe About Data
